critique: The document is an executive order from 1955 regarding the inspection of tax returns by the Senate Committee on Government Operations. It is difficult to assess its ideological tilt without more context, but it seems related to government oversight. Immigration, security/liberty, and social inclusion are not directly addressed. The order expands executive power slightly by authorizing the inspection. It centralizes power at the federal level. Economic regulation is indirectly addressed through tax returns, but the order itself doesn't impose new regulations. Therefore, the initial scores are as follows:
